inputs.task: Design and improve the LaunchBase homepage from first principles
inputs.whitePaper:
LaunchBase is an operating system for small businesses.
Not a website builder. Not another tool. Not a one-time agency project.

LaunchBase is ongoing ownership of a business's digital operating layer:
- website uptime + maintenance
- lead capture + forms
- monitoring + safety decisions
- updates + publishing cadence
- integrations + visibility
- logging + accountability

LaunchBase exists because most small businesses already have tools, but no one owns the system.
They have a website, a payment tool, a calendar, a Google profile, and logins…
…but the owner still carries the burden of making sure everything works.

LaunchBase sells relief from that cognitive load.

Core customer pain: The customer isn't buying a website. They're buying the ability to stop thinking about:
- "Is it still working?"
- "Did that form actually send?"
- "What should I post?"
- "Is anything broken?"
- "Am I missing something?"

This is background anxiety, not a feature gap.
The enemy is not "lack of tools."
The enemy is lack of ownership.

LaunchBase replaces the customer as the default system-checker.

Promise:
✅ Change is reversible
✅ Non-action is safe
✅ Silence is a valid decision
✅ Every action is logged
✅ Customer sees their real site before paying
✅ LaunchBase acts only after approval

The brand is accountability.
LaunchBase is responsibility-as-a-service.

Target customer:
- owner-operator
- service business
- small team
- not "tech obsessed"
- wants a business to run, not to "manage tools"

Tone: calm, competent, honest, operationally serious, safety-first, premium but not flashy.
This is a systems product, not a "creative brand party."

Design objective:
✅ Create instant trust
✅ Communicate the contract clearly
✅ Show the "safe-by-default" nature
✅ Make "Hand It Off" feel low-risk
✅ Explain observability in plain English
✅ Look premium enough to justify recurring ownership

currentCopy.hero: Stop carrying the system in your head. Hand it off. Keep visibility.
currentCopy.problem: No one owns the system. You're the fallback for everything.
currentCopy.solution: LaunchBase becomes the owner. You stay informed, not involved.
currentCopy.trust: Safe by default. Fully logged. Reversible.

inputs.audience: Owner-operators of service businesses (fitness studios, coffee shops, consulting firms) who want stability and accountability, not tool management
inputs.tone: Calm, minimal, trustworthy, premium. Avoid hype. Avoid 'AI magic.' Avoid exaggerated claims.
inputs.constraints: Mobile-first. Must feel like 'responsibility-as-a-service.' Must emphasize safety, reversibility, observability. Must reduce mental load while reading.

proposedChanges.value: Introduce a concise visual representation of the 'hand it off' concept with icons or imagery next to the headline to quickly communicate the core offering.
proposedChanges.rationale: Visual elements can immediately convey the idea of handing off responsibilities, enhancing understanding above the fold.
risks: Overcomplicating visuals might distract from the message.

proposedChanges.value: Combine 'Problem' and 'Solution' sections into a single section with a split layout; use the left side for the problem and the right side for the solution with bullet points for clarity.
proposedChanges.rationale: By merging these sections, users can quickly understand the problem and solution in one glance, reducing cognitive load.
risks: May reduce depth of each individual point.

proposedChanges.value: Add a sticky CTA button at the top of the page that remains visible as users scroll, labeled 'See How It Works' to encourage exploration.
proposedChanges.rationale: A consistent CTA encourages users to take action at any point during their scroll journey.
risks: Could be perceived as intrusive if not designed subtly.

proposedChanges.value: Convert pricing information into card format with a highlighted recommendation for the most popular tier; include 'what you get' bullet points for each tier.
proposedChanges.rationale: Card formats are easier to scan, and highlighting simplifies decision-making.

proposedChanges.value: Introduce an interactive timeline that outlines the logging and reversibility process to demonstrate transparency and auditability.
proposedChanges.rationale: An interactive element can make complex processes easier to understand and more engaging.
risks: Might increase page load time or distract if not implemented cleanly.

proposedChanges.value: Add a small activity-feed preview component under the hero section to visually demonstrate how observability works.
proposedChanges.rationale: A preview of the observability feature can immediately show potential customers the value of the product.
risks: Could clutter the initial layout if not designed minimally.

proposedChanges.value: Design a simplified navigation menu with key sections: 'How It Works,' 'Pricing,' 'Trust,' and 'Contact,' each with a direct link.
proposedChanges.rationale: A clear and simplified navigation helps users find information quickly, reducing frustration and cognitive load.
risks: Might oversimplify if additional sections are needed.

proposedChanges.value: Introduce a testimonial slider with short quotes from current users, placed after the 'Solution' section to build trust.
proposedChanges.rationale: Testimonials can validate the product's credibility and reassure potential customers.
risks: Could be seen as too conventional if not presented uniquely.

proposedChanges.value: Use 48px H1 (mobile: 32px) with line-height 1.1 for hero headline to create calm, confident tone
proposedChanges.rationale: A larger, well-spaced headline communicates confidence and calmness, aligning with the brand's tone.
risks: May require more vertical space, impacting layout

proposedChanges.rationale: Generous spacing creates a calm and organized presentation, reducing cognitive load.
risks: Could limit content on initial view, requiring more scrolling

proposedChanges.value: Use pill-shaped buttons with 16px padding, subtle shadow, no gradients
proposedChanges.rationale: Pill-shaped buttons with subtle shadows offer a calm, premium feel while maintaining accessibility.
risks: Pill shape may not align with all brand elements

proposedChanges.value: Set max text width to 65ch for body copy to improve readability
proposedChanges.rationale: Limiting line length improves readability and reduces mental load.
risks: May require careful layout adjustments for narrower screens

proposedChanges.value: Introduce card style with 24px padding and subtle border for content sections
proposedChanges.rationale: Cards with padding and borders offer clear separation of content, enhancing organization and readability.
risks: Additional padding may impact overall layout density

proposedChanges.value: Add 3-chip row below hero: 'Safe by default • Fully auditable • Reversible changes'
proposedChanges.rationale: Chips visually reinforce key trust elements, aligning with the brand’s promise of safety and accountability.
risks: Chips may not stand out if layout is too dense

proposedChanges.value: Ensure all text has a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 against its background
proposedChanges.rationale: High contrast improves accessibility and readability, aligning with the brand's commitment to safety and inclusivity.

proposedChanges.value: Incorporate an audit log preview with a clear, concise layout
proposedChanges.rationale: An audit log preview reinforces transparency and accountability, key aspects of the brand promise.
risks: Detail level must be balanced to avoid overwhelming users

assumptions: Input represents complete brief for homepage design task
Current copy is baseline for improvement

swarm.reason: Missing craft or critic artifact for collapse
